snippet: The United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, recommended up to 10,000 soldiers, plus 1,820 police officers to protect civilians.
abstract: United Nations Sec Gen Ban Ki-moon issues his recommendations for addressing the deadly sectarian strife in the Central African Republic, which include sending in 10,000 soldiers plus 1,820 police officers; recommendations reflect what senior UN officials describe as forceful behind-the-scenes lobbying by the Obama administration.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations secretary general, Ban Ki-moon, recommended up to 10,000 soldiers, plus 1,820 police officers to protect civilians.

headline.main: U.N. Debates the Breadth of a Mission in the Central African Republic
